OperatorName: Paslode, a Division of ITW Co.

_prev_prog_3.Description: The prevention program implemented by Paslode includes safety precautions and maintenance, monitoring, and employee training measures in order to prevent hazardous releases and employee accidents

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
In accordance with Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations Chapter 68 (40 CFR 68) promulgated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Paslode submits this Risk Management Plan (RMP) for operations at their Pontotoc, Mississippi facility.  The only substances at the Paslode plant that are subject to RMP requirements are the listed flammable chemicals 1-butene and propylene.  A mixture of these chemicals could be stored in three 6,000-gallon tanks and one 2,000-gallon tank.  The chemical mixture is used as the fuel in the fuel cells produced at the Paslode plant.  In addition, two 1,000-gallon tanks containing only propylene are located at the Paslode plant.  The most recent RMP update addressing these substances was submitted to MDEQ and USEPA in June 2009.



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy

Paslode is committed to protecting the health of its employees, the surrounding community, and the environment; therefore, it is Paslode's policy to maintain compliance with 40 CFR 68 as well as Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations promulgated as Title 29 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Chapter 1910, Section 119 (29 CFR 1910.119), and OSHA's Hazardous Operations and Emergency Response regulations (29 CFR 1910.120).



Stationary Sources and Regulated Substances

Paslode is subject to 112(r) because 1-butene and propylene gas are regulated substances, and are present at the facility in amounts greater than 10,000 pounds.



Worst-Case and Alternative Release Scenarios

As specified by the RMP rule, Paslode has performed the required off-site consequence analyses for both the worst-case and alternative release scenarios.  Administrative controls and mitigation measures include: alarms, relief valves, backup pumps, check valves, manual shutoffs, interlocks, and automatic shutoffs.



Accidental Release Prevention Program - 1-butene and propylene gas

To prevent and mitigate acciden

tal releases of 1-butene and propylene gas, Paslode has implemented several precautionary measures.  Paslode has evaluated the system for the potential of 1-butene and propylene gas releases.  Some of the controls installed to prevent catastrophic releases of 1-butene and propylene gas are process equipment (vents, pressure relief valves, backup pumps, and manual shutoffs) and automated controls (automatic shut-offs and electrical distribution system grounding). 



Paslode has developed standard operating procedures for all employees and contractors that have contact with the system that incorporate safety measures into the procedures.  These safety procedures were developed by system operators and are reviewed at a frequency sufficient to assure that they reflect current operating practice, including changes that result from changes in the technology, the equipment and the facility.  Paslode encourages employee participation in development of the control measures used at the plant.  Pursuant to written management of change procedures established by Paslode, any changes to the operating procedures are communicated to affected employees.



Five-Year Accident History

During the past five years, the Paslode facility located in Pontotoc, MS has not had an incident involving the release of flammable substances that caused injuries, death, significant property damage, or environmental damage.



Emergency Response Program

Paslode has documented emergency response procedures in a document entitled Emergency Evacuation Plan in order to facilitate response efforts in the event of an off-site hazardous substance release.  Included in the plan are measures to be taken internally by Paslode as well as measures to be taken by off-site response agencies.



To assure that the local government response agencies are familiar with Paslode's emergency response procedures, Paslode will provide copies of this and future major revisions for review by the Local Emergency Planning Com

mittee (LEPC).  Address follows:



Pontotoc County LEPC

18 South Liberty Street

Pntotoc MS 38863

Ricky Jaggers, Chairman

(662) 489-3939



To plan for a hazardous substance release with off-site effects, Paslode's Emergency Evacuation Plan includes procedures/equipment to mitigate the release, procedures to inform local response agencies, evacuation procedures, and procedures for public communication.



In the event of a hazardous substance release with off-site effects, the general public will be warned using the following methods:



- Police and fire vehicles equipped with public address systems; and 

- Door-to-door notification of residents (if necessary).



Safety procedures are benchmarked and evaluated regularly in accordance with our continuance improvement system.
